column4: In general I think if you switch to Linux you have to manage expectations... hardware vendors haven't all released open source drivers so there is a lot of hacking that goes on.
I'd say Ubuntu is the easiest of the linuces to use...
I'd say in general Linux definitely has issues with hardware support for wireless cards.  I probably help 4-5 people a night with just getting their wireless cards up and running.
Makes me think it's rather a driver issue, but my eeepc does get weird at times after coming out of hibernation
